intro: Hieracium catothamium, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It produces yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium catothamium is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
